document.docAuthor: Gonçalves, Rodrigo Barbosa & Pereira, Felipe Walter
document.masterDocTitle: New species of the cuckoo bee genus Austrosphecodes Michener, 1978 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Sphecodini) and a key for Brazilian species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of the cuckoo bee genus Austrosphecodes Michener, 1978 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Sphecodini) and a key for Brazilian species

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Laboratório de Abelhas, Departamento de Zoologia, Setor de Ciências Biológicas, Universidade Federal do Paraná, Curitiba, Paraná, Brazil.
Laboratório de Abelhas, Departamento de Zoologia, Setor de Ciências Biológicas, Universidade Federal do Paraná, Curitiba, Paraná, Brazil.

figureCitation.captionText: Fig. 10. Geographic records map. A. Austrosphecodes asmodeus sp. nov., A. balrog sp. nov., A. brasiliensis (Schrottky, 1910). B. A. cerberus sp. nov., A gorgon sp. nov., A. inornatus (Schrottky, 1902). C. A. jurupari sp. nov., A. krampus sp. nov., A. lucifer sp. nov. D. A. minarum (Schrottky, 1910), A. orcus sp. nov., A. tartarus sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Both sexes of
Austrosphecoes inornatus
can be distinguished by the combination of T1 punctate (but not strongly impressed as in
A . lucifer
sp. nov. and
A . krampus
sp. nov. ) and the mesoscutum disc punctate to densely punctate, with interspaces less than a puncture diameter and surface mostly dull. Males have submarginal rows of setae on S4 and S5, but these are short and not curved as in the similar
A . orcus
sp. nov. The species was redescribed and illustrated by Gonçalves (2017) .

paragraph.materialsCitation: BRAZIL • 1 ♂ ; São Paulo , Botucatu , Vitoriana ('Victoria'); MZSP 17614

Variation in size and ornamentation has been found in a series from Parque Estadual de Vila Velha ( Paraná ), with large females ( 10 mm ) more sculptured than smaller ones ( 8 mm ), some intermediate females were also observed. Size variation is also known for
A . brasiliensis
.
